00015 template <typename T, int N, int C>
00016 struct to_python_value< ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & > : public detail::builtin_to_python {
00017     inline PyObject * operator()(ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & x) const {
00018         numpy::dtype dtype = numpy::dtype::get_builtin<typename boost::remove_const<T>::type>();
00019         object owner = makePyObject(x.getManager());
00020         int itemsize = dtype.get_itemsize();
00021         ndarray::Vector<int,N> shape_T = x.getShape();
00022         ndarray::Vector<int,N> strides_T = x.getStrides();
00023         std::vector<Py_intptr_t> shape_char(N);
00024         std::vector<Py_intptr_t> strides_char(N);
00025         for (int n=0; n<N; ++n) {
00026             shape_char[n] = shape_T[n];
00027             strides_char[n] = strides_T[n] * itemsize;
00028         }
00029         numpy::ndarray array = numpy::from_data(x.getData(), dtype, shape_char, strides_char, owner);
00030         Py_INCREF(array.ptr());
00031         return array.ptr();
00032     }
00033     inline PyTypeObject const * get_pytype() const {
00034         return converter::object_manager_traits<numpy::ndarray>::get_pytype();
00035     }
00036 };
00037 
00038 template <typename T, int N, int C>
00039 struct to_python_value< ndarray::Array<T,N,C> & > : public detail::builtin_to_python {
00040     inline PyObject * operator()(ndarray::Array<T,N,C> & x) const {
00041         return to_python_value< ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & >()(x);
00042     }
00043     inline PyTypeObject const * get_pytype() const {
00044         return converter::object_manager_traits<numpy::ndarray>::get_pytype();
00045     }
00046 };

00050 template <typename T, int N, int C>
00051 struct arg_to_python< ndarray::Array<T,N,C> > : public handle<> {
00052     inline arg_to_python(ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & v) :
00053         handle<>(to_python_value<ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const &>()(v)) {}
00054 };
00055 
00056 template <typename T, int N, int C>
00057 struct arg_rvalue_from_python< ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & > {
00058     typedef ndarray::Array<T,N,C> result_type;
00059 
00060     static numpy::ndarray::bitflag const flags = 
00061         numpy::ndarray::bitflag(
00062             (boost::is_const<T>::value ? int(numpy::ndarray::WRITEABLE) : 0) |
00063             int(numpy::ndarray::ALIGNED)
00064         );
00065 
00066     arg_rvalue_from_python(PyObject * p) : arg(python::detail::borrowed_reference(p)) {}
00067 
00068     bool convertible() const {
00069         if (arg == object()) return true;
00070         try {
00071             numpy::ndarray array = extract<numpy::ndarray>(arg);
00072             numpy::dtype dtype = numpy::dtype::get_builtin<typename boost::remove_const<T>::type>();
00073             arg = numpy::from_object(array, dtype, N, flags);
00074         } catch (error_already_set) {
00075             handle_exception();
00076             PyErr_Clear();
00077             return false;
00078         }
00079         return true;
00080     }
00081 
00082     result_type operator()() const {
00083         if (arg == object()) return result_type();
00084         numpy::ndarray array = extract<numpy::ndarray>(arg);
00085         numpy::dtype dtype = array.get_dtype();
00086         int itemsize = dtype.get_itemsize();
00087         int total = itemsize;
00088         for (int i=1; i<=C; ++i) {
00089             if (array.strides(N-i) != total) {
00090                 if (!boost::is_const<T>::value) {
00091                     PyErr_SetString(
00092                         PyExc_ValueError,
00093                         "Array does not have the required number of contiguous dimensions for conversion."
00094                     );
00095                     throw_error_already_set();
00096                 } else {
00097                     array = numpy::from_object(
00098                         array, dtype, N, 
00099                         flags | numpy::ndarray::C_CONTIGUOUS
00100                     );
00101                     break;
00102                 }
00103             }
00104             total *= array.shape(N-i);
00105         }
00106         object obj_owner = array.get_base();
00107         if (obj_owner == object()) {
00108             obj_owner = array;
00109         }
00110         ndarray::Vector<int,N> shape;
00111         ndarray::Vector<int,N> strides;
00112         for (int i=0; i<N; ++i) {
00113             shape[i] = array.shape(i);
00114             strides[i] = array.strides(i) / itemsize;
00115         }
00116         ndarray::Array<T,N,C> r = ndarray::external(
00117             reinterpret_cast<T*>(array.get_data()), shape, strides, obj_owner
00118         );
00119         return r;
00120     }
00121 
00122     mutable object arg;
00123 };

00145 template <typename T, int N, int C>
00146 struct extract_rvalue< ndarray::Array<T,N,C> > : private noncopyable {
00147     typedef ndarray::Array<T,N,C> result_type;
00148 
00149     extract_rvalue(PyObject * x) : m_converter(x) {}
00150 
00151     bool check() const { return m_converter.convertible(); }
00152     
00153     result_type operator()() const { return m_converter(); }
00154 
00155 private:
00156     arg_rvalue_from_python< result_type const & > m_converter;
00157 };

00161 namespace numpy {
00162 
00163 template <typename T, int N, int C>
00164 numpy::ndarray array(::ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & arg) {
00165     python::to_python_value< ::ndarray::Array<T,N,C> const & > converter;
00166     numpy::ndarray result(python::detail::new_reference(converter(arg)));
00167     return result;
00168 }
